title: What is One way data binding?
description: JanuaryOne-way data binding is a concept in web development where data flows from a model (data source) to a view (user interface). Changes in the model are reflected in the view, ensuring a unidirectional data flow. This approach is commonly used in frameworks like AngularJS, React, and Vue.js.

title: What is NPM in node.js?
description: NPM, or Node Package Manager, is a tool that comes with Node.js, used for installing, managing, and sharing JavaScript packages and libraries. It handles package installation, dependency management, version control, and custom script execution for Node.js projects.

title: Difference between MongoDB database vs MySQL database
description: MongoDB is a NoSQL database with a flexible, document-oriented data model, while MySQL is a relational database with a fixed schema. MongoDB is well-suited for unstructured or semi-structured data and scalability, but it may not offer full ACID compliance. MySQL is better for applications with well-defined schemas, complex queries, and strong transactional requirements. The choice depends on your project's specific needs and your familiarity with each database.
